attributes.action: Stop the £6 Billion Benefits Cut That Endangers Our Most Vulnerable
attributes.additional_details: These drastic cuts threaten to plunge disabled individuals and those deemed unfit for work into severe poverty by slashing critical financial support. They undermine human rights, including the right to a decent standard of living, private and family life, and non-discrimination, and may force vulnerable citizens into unsuitable employment. The government must adopt fair sustainable fiscal policies, invest in programs, and uphold its legal duty to safeguard every citizen’s dignity and welfare.
attributes.background: Reverse the proposed £6 billion welfare benefits cuts that disproportionately harm disabled and vulnerable citizens. Invest in sustainable support measures, reform PIP assessments, and enhance Universal Credit to protect human rights, dignity and financial stability for those unable to work today.

rejection.details:
